content.description: Sit start with left hand on the arete and right hand on a poor undercling. Make an off-balance move to reach right out onto the face to a nice edge, then continue up using crimps and edges.  If you continue using the left arete after the start move, then it's V2.
content.location: In the middle of the west face near the bottom is a large rusty stain where a guillotine flake was removed, start just left of it. The problem continues over the stain. See Pylon Boulder West Face beta photo, problem #3.Â

content.description: Sit start with at least 1 hand on a right-facing block and poor feet, go left through the low crux to better holds. Angle back right to the lip to top out, or move left into Shock Treatment, similar grades for the finishes.
content.location: Near the right end of the west face, there's a little nook at the base where it's slightly overhung. Start here. See Pylon Boulder West Face beta photo, problems #4 and 4a.

content.description: Stand start on the arete with good holds at strange angles. Continue up the arete through the crux with good edges, sidepulls, and underclings to the highest point. You can step slightly right to good feet once your hands hit the high point.  A tricky sit start adds a couple fun moves, V1+.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter, it's tall
content.location: A nice arete towards the left end of the west face leads to the high point of the boulder. See Pylon Boulder West Face beta photo, problem #2.

content.description: Sit start with good knobby holds about 3 feet off the ground. Lip traverse left using a nice variety of holds. Crux is about midway through. Finish to the left of the high point of the boulder for full value, or you can top out as per Shock Treatment.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, it's long and tall
content.location: Start far right on the west face. See Pylon Boulder West Face beta photo, problem #5.

content.description: This triangular boulder in the Gimmes area offers half a dozen fun climbs.  It is the northern of the 2 boulders commonly referred to as the Gimmes, and is sometimes called North Gimmes Boulder. Most of the problems are on the west face, so they will get sun from midday on.
